> OK. I can see that, but I think that's a very bad idea=
. A 
> JUnit assertion test failure is not at all the same thing as 
> a Ja=
va language assert failure. They are two different things 
> and they shoul=
d be distinguishable. 

That's an interesting point, I hadn't thought of it=
.

You are right that native asserts are indeed different from test asserts=
 but
maybe an exception could be made for this special case.  The possibili=
ty of
using a native construct of the language is too good to pass up, even=
 if it
is limited (you still want to use specialized methods to test array =
or
collection equality).
